Row.Text: Some Buildings cost gold to maintain. The price depends upon the building in question, and can range from 1 to 5 per turn. The gold is deducted from your treasury each turn. Buildings that incur maintenance can be sold via the City Screen if necessary. See the section on Gold for more details on maintenance.
Crime: Introduction

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Crime[ENDCOLOR] is one of the new gameplay elements added by Cities in Development. It is a consequence of your city's development and replaces Building Maintenance in many instances. As Crime grows, it will reduce a city's yields, depending upon how those yields are apportioned - so if you're producing a lot of Gold, you'll also be producing a lot of Corruption, in turn costing you Gold.
Crime: Counteracting Crime

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Crime[ENDCOLOR] can be counteracted through the construction of Jails, Constabularies, and Police Stations, however, specific Crimes can be reduced as well, such as with the Mint, which reduces Corruption. When reducing a specific Crime, however, all other Crimes take the burden of that reduction. So building a Mint may reduce Corruption by 15%, but it will increase all other Crimes by 15%, too!
Crime: Organized

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Organized Crime[ENDCOLOR] is the consequence of too much of two specific Crimes. When two Crimes reach 50%, they will band together to form an Organized Crime. An Organized Crime will reduce your yields further.
Reduces [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime from [ICON_JFD_CRIME_PURPLE] Vandalism by 15%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Should this city be captured, the amount of [ICON_GOLD] Gold plundered by the enemy is doubled.

The Burial Tomb is a Classical-era building which increases the city's output of [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness and reduces [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime from [ICON_JFD_CRIME_PURPLE] Vandalism in the city. However, if the city is captured, the capturing civilization will gain twice as much gold as would be the case in a city without a Burial Tomb. It replaces the Temple.
Reduces enemy spy stealing rate by 25%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have a Jail.

Constabularies slow down the rate at which enemy spies can steal technologies from your city. They also reduce [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime throughout the city. The city must possess a Jail in order to construct the Constabulary.
Jail
Jails reduce [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime throughout the city.

A jail is a building for holding prisoners. Jails can range in size from a single room to a sprawling complex of buildings inside miles of barbed wire. Prisoners incarcerated in a jail may be there for a variety of reasons. Some may be common criminals; others may be brutal murderers. Some may be captured enemy soldiers and spies. Some might be political prisoners, dissidents, or simply people who fell into bad grace with their rulers. Some might be mad - incarceration being a common way to deal with the insane before the creation of mental hospitals and sanitariums.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The facilities inside jails vary widely. A jail for commoners or enemies of the state might be horrible, overcrowded dark pits that are infested with rats, while a king's prison may be indistinguishable from royal quarters, except for the small matter of which side of the door on which the guards stand. Mostly, jails are unpleasant and unhappy places.
Produces no [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime.

The Mud Pyramid Mosque is a Songhai unique building, replacing the Temple. The Mud Pyramid Mosque greatly increases the city's [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, speeding the growth of the city's territory and the civilization's acquisition of Social Policies. The Mud Pyramid Mosque produces no [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime.
Police Stations slow down the rate at which enemy spies can steal technologies from your city. They also reduce [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime throughout the city.
Prison
Increases the threshold at which [ICON_JFD_ORGANIZED_CRIME] Organized Crime emerges by 10%.
Prisons reduce the chance of [ICON_JFD_ORGANIZED_CRIME] Organized Crime emerging in a city. Build Prisons in cities where the combination of two Crimes is particularly high.

A prison, correctional facility, or penitentiary is a facility in which inmates are forcibly confined and denied a variety of freedoms under the authority of the state as a form of punishment. The most common use of prisons is within a criminal justice system. People charged with crimes may be imprisoned until they are brought to trial; those pleading or being found guilty of crimes at trial may be sentenced to a specified period of imprisonment. Besides their use for punishing civil crimes, authoritarian regimes also frequently use prisons and jails as tools of political repression to punish what are deemed political crimes, often without trial or other legal due process; this use is illegal under most forms of international law governing fair administration of justice. In times of war, prisoners of war or detainees may be detained in military prisons or prisoner of war camps, and large groups of civilians might be imprisoned in internment camps.

Anarchists

Because [ICON_JFD_CRIME_RED] Treason and [ICON_JFD_CRIME_PURPLE] Vandalism exceed the Organized Crime threshold in this city, [ICON_JFD_ORGANIZED_CRIME_ANARCHISTS] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Anarchists[ENDCOLOR] decrease the city's [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness ([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]-10%[ENDCOLOR]) and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture ([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]-10%[ENDCOLOR])!
JFD: Crime: Anarchists
Counterfeiters

Because [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLUE] Fraud and [ICON_JFD_CRIME_WHITE] Heresy exceed the Organized Crime threshold in this city, [ICON_JFD_ORGANIZED_CRIME_COUNTERFEITERS] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Counterfeiters[ENDCOLOR] decrease the city's [ICON_PEACE] Faith ([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]-10%[ENDCOLOR]) and [ICON_RESEARCH] Science ([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]-10%[ENDCOLOR])!
JFD: Crime: Counterfeiters
Mafia

Because [ICON_JFD_CRIME_YELLOW] Corruption and [ICON_JFD_CRIME_ORANGE] Theft exceed the Organized Crime threshold in this city, [ICON_JFD_ORGANIZED_CRIME_MAFIA] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Mafia[ENDCOLOR] decrease the city's [ICON_GOLD] Gold ([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]-10%[ENDCOLOR]) and [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production ([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]-10%[ENDCOLOR])!
JFD: Crime: Mafia
Smugglers

Because [ICON_JFD_CRIME_CYAN] Abduction and [ICON_JFD_CRIME_PINK] Drug Abuse exceed the Organized Crime threshold in this city, [ICON_JFD_ORGANIZED_CRIME_SMUGGLERS] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Saboteurs[ENDCOLOR] decrease the city's [ICON_JFD_HEALTH] Health and increase the city's [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism!
JFD: Crime: Smugglers
Terrorists

Because [ICON_JFD_CRIME_GRAY] Sabotage and [ICON_JFD_CRIME_GREEN] Violence exceed the Organized Crime threshold in this city, [ICON_JFD_ORGANIZED_CRIME_TERRORISTS] [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Terrorists[ENDCOLOR] decrease the city's [ICON_STRENGTH] Defense ([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]-10%[ENDCOLOR]) and [ICON_FOOD] Food ([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]-10%[ENDCOLOR])!
JFD: Crime: Terrorists
Reduces [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime from [ICON_JFD_CRIME_GREEN] Violence by 5% in all Cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]

Commonwealth

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Commonwealth[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in every City and +5% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in cities when constructing Buildings. Reduces [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime from [ICON_JFD_CRIME_ORANGE] Theft by 15% in all Cities.

Commonwealth is a traditional English term for a political community founded for the common good. Historically it has sometimes been synonymous with "republicanism". The original phrase "the common-wealth" or "the common weal" comes from the old meaning of "wealth", which is "well-being", and is itself a loose translation of the Latin res publica (republic). The term literally meant "common well-being".

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Scientific Revolution[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Boosts [ICON_RESEARCH] Science gained from research agreements by 50%. Reduces [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime from [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLUE] Fraud by 15% in all Cities.
International Criminal Court
Contribute this city's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards the International Criminal Court project.
International Criminal Court

Begins the International Criminal Court project. Once underway, Civilizations can contribute [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards its completion by selecting it in the city production list. When complete, Civilizations receive bonuses based on how much they contributed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_TROPHY_GOLD]: {TXT_KEY_LEAGUE_PROJECT_REWARD_JFD_INTERNATIONAL_CRIMINAL_COURT_3_HELP}[NEWLINE][ICON_TROPHY_CYAN]: {TXT_KEY_LEAGUE_PROJECT_REWARD_JFD_INTERNATIONAL_CRIMINAL_COURT_2_HELP}[NEWLINE][ICON_TROPHY_BRONZE]: {TXT_KEY_LEAGUE_PROJECT_REWARD_JFD_INTERNATIONAL_CRIMINAL_COURT_1_HELP}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Available once any Civilization discovers Radio.
International Criminal Court

Leaders from around the world have gathered to observe the creation of an International Criminal Court. As the world watches, Civilizations pledge their support to the cause and pursuit of a universal justice.
Observing Member
[ICON_JFD_ORGANIZED_CRIME] Organized Crime Threshold increased by 5%.
Signatory Member
[ICON_JFD_ORGANIZED_CRIME] Organized Crime Threshold increased by 15%.
Hosting Member
[ICON_JFD_ORGANIZED_CRIME] Organized Crime Threshold increased by 20%.
JFD: ICC Bronze
JFD: ICC Silver
JFD: ICC Gold
Decriminalization

Decriminalization is the abolition of criminal penalties in relation to certain acts, perhaps retroactively, though perhaps regulated permits or fines might still apply. Decriminalization reflects changing social and moral views. A society may come to the view that an act is not harmful, should no longer be criminalized, or is otherwise not a matter to be addressed by the justice system.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Decriminalization[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Reduces [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime from [ICON_JFD_CRIME_CYAN] Abduction, [ICON_JFD_CRIME_RED] Treason, and [ICON_JFD_CRIME_GREEN] Violence by 20% in all Cities.
Secret Police

Secret police are intelligence services or police and law enforcement agencies which operate in secrecy. Therefore, they have little to no transparency, accountability or oversight. A secret police organization is often used beyond the law by totalitarian states to protect the political power of an individual dictator or an authoritarian (autocratic) political regime.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Secret Police[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Reduces [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime from [ICON_JFD_CRIME_WHITE] Heresy, [ICON_JFD_CRIME_RED] Treason, [ICON_JFD_CRIME_PURPLE] Vandalism by 20% in all Cities.
Worker Councils

A workers' council is a form of political and economic organization in which a single place of work or enterprise, such as a factory, school, or farm, is controlled collectively by the workers of that workplace, through the core principle of temporary and instantly revocable delegates.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Worker Councils[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Reduces [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime from [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLUE] Fraud, [ICON_JFD_CRIME_ORANGE] Theft, and [ICON_JFD_CRIME_RED] Treason by 20% in all Cities.
JFD: Crime Notification

[ICON_GOLD] Gold cost of upgrading military units reduced by 20%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Reduces [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime from [ICON_JFD_CRIME_CYAN] Abduction and [ICON_JFD_CRIME_YELLOW] Corruption by 20% in all Cities.
Requires Aesthetics. Eliminates [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime from Great Works the city. Contains 3 slots for Great Works of Art.
White Tower
Provides a free Castle in the city. Eliminates [ICON_JFD_CRIME_BLACK] Crime from [ICON_JFD_CRIME_RED] Treason in all cities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+4 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism after Electricity.
[NEWLINE]"Is not this house as nigh heaven as my own?"[NEWLINE] - Thomas Moore[NEWLINE]

Her Majesty's Royal Palace and Fortress, known as the Tower of London, is a historic castle located on the north bank of the River Thames in central London. It lies within the London Borough of Tower Hamlets, separated from the eastern edge of the square mile of the City of London by the open space known as Tower Hill. It was founded towards the end of 1066 as part of the Norman Conquest of England. The White Tower, which gives the entire castle its name, was built by William the Conqueror in 1078, and was a resented symbol of oppression, inflicted upon London by the new ruling elite. The castle was used as a prison from 1100 (Ranulf Flambard) until 1952 (Kray twins), although that was not its primary purpose. A grand palace early in its history, it served as a royal residence. As a whole, the Tower is a complex of several buildings set within two concentric rings of defensive walls and a moat. There were several phases of expansion, mainly under Kings Richard the Lionheart, Henry III, and Edward I in the 12th and 13th centuries. The general layout established by the late 13th century remains despite later activity on the site.
Crime
